questions.question: How many players are on a football (soccer) team?
questions.explanation: A football (soccer) team has 11 players on the field.

questions.question: How long is an Olympic swimming pool?
questions.explanation: An Olympic swimming pool is 50 meters in length.

questions.question: Which sport is known as the "gentleman’s game"?
questions.explanation: Cricket is often referred to as the 'gentleman's game'.

questions.question: How many rings are there in the Olympic symbol?
questions.explanation: The Olympic symbol has five interlocking rings.

questions.question: In cricket, how many balls are bowled in an over?
questions.explanation: An over in cricket consists of six balls.

questions.question: Which country has won the most FIFA World Cups?
questions.explanation: Brazil has won the most FIFA World Cups.

questions.question: The term “love” is used in which sport?
questions.explanation: The term 'love' is used in tennis to mean a score of zero.

questions.question: Who won the 2019 Cricket World Cup?
questions.explanation: England won the 2019 Cricket World Cup, defeating New Zealand.

questions.question: What is the national sport of Japan?
questions.explanation: Sumo wrestling is the national sport of Japan.

questions.question: Which NBA player is known as “King James”?
questions.explanation: LeBron James is widely known by his nickname, 'King James'.

questions.question: Which country won the first ever FIFA World Cup (1930)?
questions.explanation: Uruguay won the first FIFA World Cup in 1930.

questions.question: In basketball, how many points is a free throw worth?
questions.explanation: A free throw in basketball is worth one point.

questions.question: Which country hosted the 2016 Olympics?
questions.explanation: Brazil hosted the 2016 Summer Olympics in Rio de Janeiro.

questions.question: Who holds the record for the most home runs in MLB history?
questions.explanation: Barry Bonds holds the record for most career home runs in Major League Baseball.

questions.question: In chess, what is the only move where two pieces move in a single turn?
questions.explanation: Castling is a special move where the king and a rook move simultaneously.

questions.question: Who has won the most Grand Slam tennis titles (men)?
questions.explanation: As of 2025, Novak Djokovic holds the record for the most men's Grand Slam titles.

questions.question: Which Indian cricketer scored 6 sixes in an over in the 2007 T20 World Cup?
questions.explanation: Yuvraj Singh achieved this feat against England in the 2007 T20 World Cup.

questions.question: Who is India’s first individual Olympic gold medalist?
questions.explanation: Abhinav Bindra won India's first individual Olympic gold medal in shooting in 2008.

questions.question: In Formula 1, which driver has the most World Championships (as of 2025)?
questions.explanation: As of 2025, Lewis Hamilton holds the record for the most Formula 1 World Championships.

questions.question: Which country invented table tennis?
questions.explanation: Table tennis originated in England, UK.

questions.question: The Ashes trophy is contested between which two countries?
questions.explanation: The Ashes is a Test cricket series played between England and Australia.

questions.question: Who won the Golden Boot in FIFA World Cup 2018?
questions.explanation: Harry Kane won the Golden Boot at the 2018 FIFA World Cup.

questions.question: Which cricketer is the fastest to score 10,000 ODI runs?
questions.explanation: Virat Kohli is the fastest to reach 10,000 runs in One Day Internationals.

questions.question: Where did the first modern Olympics take place (1896)?
questions.explanation: The first modern Olympic Games were held in Athens, Greece.

questions.question: Which Indian boxer won an Olympic bronze in 2012?
questions.explanation: Mary Kom won a bronze medal in boxing at the 2012 London Olympics.

questions.question: Who is the only athlete to win Olympic gold in 100m, 200m, and 4x100m three times?
questions.explanation: Usain Bolt is the only athlete to win these three events in three consecutive Olympics.

questions.question: Which cricket stadium is called the "Mecca of Cricket"?
questions.explanation: Lord’s Cricket Ground in London is known as the 'Mecca of Cricket'.

questions.question: Which sport awards the Davis Cup?
questions.explanation: The Davis Cup is the premier international team event in men's tennis.

questions.question: Which Indian wrestler won Olympic silver in 2012?
questions.explanation: Sushil Kumar won a silver medal in wrestling at the 2012 London Olympics.

questions.question: In football, which club is known as “The Red Devils”?
questions.explanation: Manchester United is famously nicknamed 'The Red Devils'.
